isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION, SINGLE SPEED AXLES: SPICER D135-S, F155-S, F170-S SERIES - PINION POSITION

svcsubsecinfo.para: Ring gears and pinions are supplied in matched sets only. Matching numbers on both the pinion and ring gear are etched for verification. If a new gear set is being used, verify the numbers of each pinion and ring gear before proceeding with assembly (refer to GEAR SET IDENTIFICATION)

Pinion position is based on the nominal mounting distance measured from the centerline of the ring gear to the button end of the pinion ( Figure 53). This dimension is controlled by selectively shimming between the pinion cage assembly and the carrier housing. The nominal dimensions are 3.2530 inches (82.63 mm) for the D135-S and 3.4725 inches (88.20 mm) for the F155-S and F170-S.

note.para: Be sure mounting surfaces are free of burrs and dirt prior to assembly as they will affect pinion position.
